meanings.definition: In a manner that is impossible to endure or tolerate.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was unendurably annoying.
meanings.sent2: She cried unendurably when she lost her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing unendurably woke up the whole house.
meanings.sent4: The heat in the desert was unendurably intense.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in the movie was unendurably gripping.

meanings.definition: To an extreme degree that cannot be endured.
meanings.sent1: He was unendurably hungry after skipping lunch.
meanings.sent2: The pain in his leg became unendurably sharp.
meanings.sent3: The wait for the concert tickets felt unendurably long.
meanings.sent5: The workload on Monday mornings was unendurably heavy.
